Key:
So much happened in the morning, but I managed to
finish breakfast. So what should I do today?
I have a good idea, Shido!

Oh, you're energetic. Okay, sure. Go ahead, Tohka
Yatogami-san. Let's hear your idea.
Yes. We're going on a date!
I-I knew it. I had a feeling you'd say that.
O-Oh, you don't want to?
No, that's not it.

(But there's so many people here. If I agree to a
date with Tohka, I know it's going to be chaotic.)

I mean, we're all gathered here, so why don't we
do something together?
Oh, I see...!
Then I have a good idea.

I have a bad feeling about this, but go ahead.
What's your idea?

Shido and I will go on a date. The others will
watch from behind. That way, everyone can
participate.
What are you talking about?! You rotten...

I knew this would happen. So seriously, what
should we do?
Then, how about this?
Oh, Kotori. You have any good ideas?

Why don't we all go to a karaoke room? That way we
can all participate.
I see. That's true.
Karaoke... I... want to try.
Ohhh, Yoshino seems curious.
My, that does sound fun.
If it's singing, I am unchallenged.

Hehe, interesting. We tornadoes are
amazing singers.
Agreed. I like to sing.

This seems really good. Tohka, Origami, is that
okay with you two?
No problem.
Sure, karaoke is fun!

(Come to think of it, these two sang at the
culture festival. Tohka and Origami sang almost
to the point of making professionals look bad.)
I told you it was a good idea.

Yeah, you're amazing as usual. But there are other
things we can do in a big group. I'm surprised you
decided on this.

You idiot. It's the opposite. I figured singing
would be good, so that's why I chose karaoke.
What do you mean the opposite?

I know Arusu can understand singing, but I don't
think she's ever experienced it.

By experiencing it, she might have some kind of
change of heart. I admit, it's sort of wishful
thinking.
I see. I get it.

(With that said, we all decided to go to karaoke
in the afternoon.)

(And so, here we are. I went to the bathroom first
and then to the karaoke room...)
Wow, Shido. This room is all-you-can-sing?

That's right, Tohka. Oh, but don't just put in all
the songs you want. Make sure to take turns...

Shido-san. Don't just stand there, why don't you
sit? Or, do you not want to sit next to me?

Shido, this seat is open, too. Or you can sit on
my lap...
Hahaha...

Shido-san... I don't know how to put
in the songs...
That's it. Go, Yoshino! Nonchalantly sit next to\nShido-kun!
Oh. H-Hey, wait. Let me go over there.
Wahhh! Shido, listen to me!
Why are you so upset, Kaguya?

Compassion. She challenged Miku to karaoke and
lost. There, there, Kaguya. You're a strong girl.

Ohhh, you did the score battle and lost, huh?
It was pretty bold of you to challenge Miku in
singing.

I wanted to attack a powerful enemy. But the Night
Siren's voice just broke me... *sniffle*...

Translation. This is the result of her trying to
redeem herself from the culture festival.
Oh, I see.

Hehe. I wouldn't lose a singing battle. Darling,
praise me.

Miku, you're amazing... Wait, they're all above 98
points?! Wow...
(Man, she should go easy on them a little.)

(We just got in, but it sure is lively. Well, it
seems like everyone's enjoying themselves,
so I guess it's good that we came...)

Why are you looking all proud of yourself for?
Come here.

What is it, Kotori? Everyone seems to be having
fun, it's great.
Don't it's great" me. Don't just have fun. Make

Operator: sure to flag an event with the Spirits."

Key:
O-Oh right. I guess our lives are on the
line, huh?
I'm going to go check up on Maria, then.
Yes, go.
(Where's Maria sitting?)

(Oh, there she is. She's sitting alone in the
corner. I'm going to move over.)
So what do you think, Maria? Um... You having fun?

Yes, Shido. It's... very interesting. Singing is
different when you actually hear it.

I know, right? It's fun to sing with everyone. Do
you not want to sing anything, Maria? I can
teach you.

Yes. I'm fine. Rather, I wish to hear you sing
with someone, Shido Itsuka.

Yes. I heard that singing with someone is called a
duet. I think it would be a great situation to
observe.

(I see. A duet, huh... If Maria wants to see it, I
guess I could give it a try.)
(But who should I sing with?)
Tohka
Origami
Yoshino
Kurumi
Next
Kotori
The Yamai Sisters
Miku
Previous
All right, Tohka. Let's sing together!

Okay, Shido! We're singing together?
Perfect timing.

Oh, great!
...Wait, what?

You see, this book doesn't have many songs
I know...

(Oh, yeah. Tohka's a Spirit, so she's not familiar
with the world. She doesn't have many songs in her
repertoire.)
I see... Then... what should we do?
Any song you know, Shido!

Songs I know? But then you won't be able to sing,
Tohka.

It's fine. I will learn it as I hear you sing.
For the lyrics, I just need to look at the
screen, don't I?

(I see. Tohka's quick at learning songs by
listening. She must have a good musical
sense to start.)
Got it, Tohka! Follow me!
Sorry, Tohka...
You don't have to apologize, Shido!

No, I let my guard down. I thought it would
be okay if the lyrics were on the screen, but I
didn't think there would be so much English.

Yeah... I'm not good at English. My grades aren't
very good.

But still, no need to apologize. I had fun just
mimicking your song.
Tohka...

Shido. Sing another song. It was fun
singing with you.
...Okay. I'll choose a song you might know, then.

(For the next song I chose, as expected, Tohka
sang random lyrics. But she still seemed to have
fun, so I think it's all right?)

(I sense someone staring...
Origami is staring at me.)
Uh, Origami. Do you want to sing together?
Yes.

(That was fast! She answered before I could even
blink.)
Th-Then... Let's sing a song together.
Got it. Come here next to me...

We're just singing together, so I don't think I
need to move seats...

That's not true. This is a necessity. We need to
be in sync, so we should be near one another.
If you want, you can sit on my lap...

I-I'll sit next to you! Please, let me just sit
next to you!
Yeah...? Or, I don't mind sitting on your lap.

Origami, what do you want to sing?! Let's choose a
song!
...I see. Got it.
(Why does she look so sad?!)
You can choose the song.
Are you sure?

I don't mind. I can sing most songs. So please
choose freely...
I see. If that's what you say.

(It's not like there was a song I really wanted to
sing, so I chose a generic pop song that I figured
Origami would know.)
Oh... It's starting.

(Origami is an amazing singer. Although it's not
like the power of Miku's singing as a Spirit, it's
still amazing.)

(If only she had an expression. No matter how much
emotion's in her voice, her expression still
doesn't change.)
(That expression... That face...)
Close! Origami, your face is too close!
Phew... My duet with Shido was very fun.
I see... That's nice. I'm really tired.
It was amazing, climaxing with Shido.

In terms of singing, right?! The key was
pretty high.
...It was amazing.

(She sure seems to be entranced, but I guess she's
satisfied from the singing. That's how I decided
to take it.)
So, who should I sing with...?
Um... Shido-san...
Oh, Yoshino? What's the matter?
...Um, would you like to sing with me?
Hey, hey, Shido-kun. Sing with us!
Sure, let's sing together.
...Okay!
Isn't that nice, Yoshino!

(That's so sweet. Come to think of it, I don't
really hang out with Yoshino like this. I want
her to have a good time.)

All right, what kind of song do you want to sing,
Yoshino?
Oh... um... I have a song I want to sing.
Oh, really?
Despite her appearance, Yoshino sure loves TV.\nShe can sing any popular song.
...Um, please leave it to me! Um, the number is...

Oh, you can do it yourself? Wait... Yoshinon,
you're going to sing too?
Shido. Don't be a dummy. I'll just watch so I\ndon't get in between you two.
...? What do you mean?

(As I pondered that, the song that Yoshino chose
began to play.)
I see...

(What Yoshino chose was a pure love song. The
intro alone made Yoshino blush.)
Woo-hooo!

(Th-This is embarrassing. But no, Yoshino chose
the song for me. I have to sing it!)
Maybe only you are the one to wake me up...\n*whimper*... Shido-san, please don't look at me\ntoo much...
S-Sorry, Yoshino!
Shido-kun next! It's your part next!
R-Right. Uh... I used to like you when I was a
Ahhh! Sh-Shido-san, I'm embarrassed.

(This isn't good. Yoshino is blushing so much that
it's making me blush. This is a lot harder than I
anticipated!)

(We continued to sing as we both turned red
looking at one another, but managed to finish.)
Shido-san. Would you like to sing with me?
A duet with you?
I'd love to sing with you.

(*Grunt* I just got the chills. Her eyes looked
like she caught some kind of prey.)
Well, hmm... What should I do?

You don't want to sing with me, huh? That makes
me so sad, I want to cry.
O-Okay, Kurumi. Let's sing together.
(Ngh... It's not fair that she says it like that.)
Hehehe... Thank you. I have an idea.
Idea...?
Oh, so this is what she means.

(Kurumi's idea was for us to sing while holding
hands, but with a rule that if I let go or stopped
singing, I'd get hit with a penalty.)
I feel like I'm in a trap.
Did you say something?
N-Nothing.
I see. Then it's your turn, Shido-san.
Okay....
Whoaaa, what the...!

(Kurumi entwined her fingers in mine and was
rubbing the back of my hand.)
Go ahead, Shido-san. Sing.

(Kurumi completely cornered me. Is this what she
planned?!)
Uh... Ah... Ohhhh!
(Kurumi's finger movements made me... Made me...!)

*Giggle*. You did really well, Shido-san. So, what
kind of punishment will you receive?

(In the end, I couldn't take it, and let go of her
hand.)
Please be nice.

Hehe. Let's see... Can you sing another song
with me?
P-Please, nooooo!
(Kurumi's plotting continued to trouble me.)
(All right, I made up my mind!)
Kotori, let's sing together.
Wh-What?! M-Me...?
Yeah. We might as well have a sibling duet.
Don't worry about me. Sing with Tohka or Yoshino.

Why are you so embarrassed? Don't act tough, just
sing with me. It's okay for you to play around
from time to time.

And besides, I want to enjoy karaoke. I haven't
gone in a while. Come on.

Shido... I-If you say so, fine.
I guess I can sing.

(All right. I was thinking of Reine-san's advice,
but it seems like it worked.)

(Reine-san... Is she still watching through the
monitor? I need to thank her. Thank you,
Reine-san.)
...Hm? Did you say something?
N-Nothing. So what should we sing?
Shido... You can sing any song, right?

(There's fire in Kotori's eyes. She is going to
sing that song...!)
Bring it on. I will follow you to the end.
Interesting...! Show me what you've got.
This is my...
This is my...
Super medley!

(Well.. It's just a medley of anime songs and hero
themes. But they were all shouting songs where you
scream your lungs out and lose your voice.)

But I'm going to show you that I can keep up this
time!

(I hope my shouting gets through. I'm pushing it
to my limit...!)
Over already? It was just one set.

*Cough, cough*... I can... still... si...
*choke*... *grunt*... I can't...

(I lost yet again. I could see Kotori's twin tails
fluttering. Ah... What red. It's as if I'm looking
at a sunset.)

I have the mic. I want to go one more set. Tohka,
you want to sing? Come on up here.

(As my consciousness faded, I could hear Kotori's
voice from afar. I lost...)
(Hmmm. Who should I sing with?)

Hehe... Seems like you're contemplating. Sing with
the Spirit duo...!
Request. Shido, let's sing together.
Oh, Kaguya. Yuzuru. You've come to invite me?

Hehe... You belong to us, yet you act
like you don't.

Correction. Kaguya has been looking at you like a
puppy wanting her master's attention.

Shut up, Yuzuru! That's totally not true. And I'm
not a puppy, I'm a three-headed dog.

Kaguya, you're not making any sense... But thanks
for the invite. Let's sing together.

...Okay! Hehe... When we Hurricane Children and
Shido combine forces, we become the Ultimate Trio.

Well, we're just three people singing. You guys
must be really good at karaoke.

Affirmative. You know that we challenged one
another 99 times before we met you, Shido.

Of course. Karaoke is our pastime of choice when
we're bored.
I see... So, you guys compete even at karaoke.

Now, Shido! I've prepared the song. Are you ready?
You can beg for your life now!

What kind of karaoke is this?!
...Oh, the intro sounds like a rock song.

Listen carefully. The maddening play of the
phantom of the Yamais. The stars in the
heavens will come falling down.

...Hey, Yuzuru. What is up with that chanting? Or
is she singing?

Support. Please don't mind her. It's Kaguya's
usual sickness.
Hehe... Now it's time for Misa!
(This is getting crazy.)
Well, you guys were pretty good.

...O...f...cour... *pant, pant*... se...
This is... nothing for us... Yama...
Praise. Shido, I had fun.

(In the end, Kaguya continued to scream-sing her
heart out. She'll definitely wear herself out at
this rate.)
Shi...do... One more... song...

Don't push it, Kaguya. Rest for a while.
Yuzuru, let her sleep there.
Rest. Kaguya, please calm down...
*Whimper*...
Kaguya, you pushed yourself too far...!

(In the end, Yuzuru and I took care of Kaguya, who
was knocked out.)

(Who do I want to sing with? I can't help but look
at Miku.)
Hey, Miku. You want to sing the next one together?
Oh, darling, you've come to invite me?

Yeah. Well, at the school festival we were
enemies, remember? I figured it'd be so
nice to sing with you this time.
Hehe. I would never turn down a request from you.
Oh, really? That's awesome. Glad I asked you.

But I have one request. Will you listen?
To my request, that is.
What is it?

(Why do I have a bad feeling about this? What is
she going to ask me?)
Wow... You look so good in that outfit.
Amazing, Shiori-san!
Hey, Miku... Where did you find this costume?

Huh? Well, when we entered, the front had a sign
that they also had cosplay costumes, so I went and
borrowed it.
(Crap... I wasn't paying attention.)
H-Hey Miku? If I take this off...

You can't. And besides, you're going to sing my
song with me. We have to be girls.
(Ah. Miku still loves girls, huh...)
Damn it, then I'm going to go all out.

*Whimper* I feel like I lost an important
part of me.

Now, now, don't be like that! You were adorable,
darling.
Please, forget what you saw.

Awww, that's too bad... Then, how was my song?
I sang it for you.

(That's right. I was singing with Miku. I was too
preoccupied with myself dressed as a girl...)
Yeah, it was great. You're amazing as always.
Hehe, thank you. That makes me so happy.
Jeez, you're exaggerating...

No, I'm not. I mean... you're the most precious
person in the whole wide world.

(I can never beat Miku. She's really made me feel
this way.)

It's been a while since I sang so much. It seems
like everyone's happy.
Huh? Where's Maria...?

(I looked around, and saw Maria, who appeared to be
lost in thought.)
Hey, Maria. Let's go home.
How did you like today? Did you see anything new?

Yes. It was a very valuable experience... I'm
going to take these results and gather new data.
Maria, don't tell me...

I feel like I'm close to an answer.
So please, show me.
Okay, I'll cooperate.

(I saw Maria's expression as my consciousness went
dark. I felt like she was smiling.)
